title: Dispute Over Carbon’s ‘Social Costs’ Could Delay Oil Leases, U.S. Says
sub_head: The Biden administration’s effort to expand use of a metric of the social cost of greenhouse-gas emissions hit a legal roadblock
body:
The Biden administration is appealing a federal-district court ruling in Louisiana that it says could delay lease sales and permits for oil-and-gas drilling on federal lands.
At issue is the Biden administration’s attempt to adopt a sevenfold increase in a metric called the social cost of carbon, which assigns a dollar value to the harm caused by greenhouse gas emissions.
